canonical_explanation.text: School is a wonderful place where we learn, play, and make friends. We follow school rules like coming on time, wearing our uniform, keeping our school clean, and listening to our teacher. Our classroom has many things that help us learn, such as a blackboard, chalk, desks, chairs, books, and bags. Many people work in our school to help us, like teachers, the principal, the peon, the gardener, and the librarian. Being a good friend means sharing, helping others, and working together as a team.
rules: We must follow school rules to learn well and stay safe.
Classroom objects like blackboard, chalk, books, and pencils help us learn.
Many helpers in school take care of us and keep the school running.
A good friend shares, helps, and plays together without fighting.
Working as a team means doing things together and helping each other.

questions.question_text: What should you do when the teacher is talking?
questions.explanation_correct: When the teacher is talking, we should listen quietly. This is an important school rule that helps us learn better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Talking to friends, playing with your bag, or looking outside are not good habits when the teacher is speaking. We should listen quietly to learn.

questions.question_text: Which of these is found in a classroom?
questions.explanation_correct: A blackboard is found in a classroom. The teacher writes on it with chalk to teach us new things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stove, washing machine, and fridge are found in a house, not in a classroom. A blackboard is used in the classroom for teaching.

questions.question_text: Who is the head of a school?
questions.explanation_correct: The principal is the head of the school. The principal takes care of the whole school and makes sure everything runs well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The peon, gardener, and bus driver are all important school helpers, but the principal is the head of the school who manages everything.

questions.question_text: A good friend always ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A good friend always shares and helps others. This makes everyone happy and our class a nice place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fighting, taking others' things, or shouting are not things a good friend does. A good friend shares and helps others.

questions.question_text: We use a ___ to write on the blackboard.
questions.explanation_correct: We use chalk to write on the blackboard. Chalk is white or coloured and makes marks that everyone in the class can see.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pencil, crayon, and pen are used to write on paper or in notebooks. Chalk is the correct tool for writing on a blackboard.

questions.question_text: Who teaches us in school?
questions.explanation_correct: The teacher teaches us in school. Teachers help us learn to read, write, and understand new things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The gardener takes care of plants, the peon helps with tasks around the school, and the sweeper keeps the school clean. The teacher is the one who teaches us.

questions.question_text: Which is a good school rule?
questions.explanation_correct: Coming to school on time is a good school rule. It helps us not miss our lessons and shows we are responsible.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coming late, throwing papers, and running in the corridor are bad habits. Coming to school on time is the correct school rule.

questions.question_text: We keep our books and notebooks in a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We keep our books and notebooks in a school bag. It helps us carry all our things safely to school and back home.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bucket, basket, or box are not used to carry school things. A school bag is what we use to carry our books and notebooks.

questions.question_text: Who takes care of the plants and garden in school?
questions.explanation_correct: The gardener takes care of the plants and garden in school. The gardener waters the plants, cuts the grass, and keeps the garden beautiful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The teacher teaches lessons, the principal manages the school, and the librarian looks after books. The gardener is the one who takes care of the school garden.

questions.question_text: Teamwork means ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Teamwork means working together with friends. When we work as a team, we can do things better and faster, and it is more fun!
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doing things alone, not sharing, or fighting are the opposite of teamwork. Teamwork means helping each other and working together.

questions.question_text: Where do we read books in school?
questions.explanation_correct: We read books in the library. The library has many story books, picture books, and other books for us to enjoy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The kitchen, garden, and car park are not places where we go to read books in school. The library is the special room in school for reading books.

questions.question_text: We use a ___ to rub out pencil marks.
questions.explanation_correct: We use an eraser to rub out pencil marks. If we make a mistake while writing, we can use an eraser to correct it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ruler is for drawing straight lines, a sharpener is for making the pencil point sharp, and a crayon is for colouring. An eraser is used to rub out pencil marks.

questions.question_text: Which school rule keeps us safe?
questions.explanation_correct: Walking in a line keeps us safe. When we walk in a line, we do not bump into each other and nobody falls down.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running on stairs, pushing friends, and climbing on desks are all dangerous. Walking in a line is the safe school rule.

questions.question_text: Who looks after the books in the library?
questions.explanation_correct: The librarian looks after the books in the library. The librarian helps us find books and makes sure we return them on time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The gardener looks after plants, the peon helps with school tasks, and the bus driver drives the school bus. The librarian takes care of the library and books.

questions.question_text: We play and run during ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We play and run during the games period. This is the special time in school when we can play games and do exercises on the playground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maths class, assembly, and Hindi class are not times to play and run. The games period is when we play games and enjoy outdoor activities.

questions.question_text: We use a ___ to draw straight lines.
questions.explanation_correct: We use a ruler to draw straight lines. A ruler has a straight edge and markings that help us draw neat lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pencil is for writing, an eraser is for rubbing out mistakes, and a sharpener is for making pencils sharp. A ruler is the right tool for drawing straight lines.

questions.question_text: Ria's friend forgot her pencil. What should Ria do?

options.text: Tell the teacher to scold her

questions.explanation_correct: Ria should share her pencil. A good friend helps when someone is in need. Sharing makes both friends happy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Laughing, telling the teacher to scold, or ignoring are not what good friends do. A good friend shares and helps when someone needs something.

questions.question_text: Rohan comes to school late every day. What should he do?

options.text: Wake up early and come on time

questions.explanation_correct: Rohan should wake up early and come to school on time. Coming on time is an important school rule that helps us learn better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Continuing to be late, skipping school, or blaming others will not help. The best thing is to wake up early and reach school on time.

questions.question_text: The school garden looks dry and the plants are wilting. Who should we tell?
questions.explanation_correct: We should tell the gardener. The gardener takes care of the school plants and garden and will water the dry plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bus driver, librarian, and canteen helper have different jobs. The gardener is the person who looks after plants and the garden.

questions.question_text: Your class is doing a group activity. Amit does not want to share colours with his group. What will happen?

options.text: The group cannot do the work properly

questions.explanation_correct: If Amit does not share, the group cannot do the work properly. In teamwork, everyone needs to share and help for things to go well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not sharing hurts the team. The group will struggle to finish the activity. Sharing and helping is important for teamwork.

questions.question_text: Priya sees paper on the classroom floor. What should she do?

options.text: Pick it up and put it in the dustbin

questions.explanation_correct: Priya should pick up the paper and put it in the dustbin. Keeping our classroom clean is a good school habit.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stepping on it, ignoring it, or kicking it under the desk will not keep the classroom clean. We should always put waste in the dustbin.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a room in a school?
questions.explanation_correct: A bedroom is not a room in a school. Bedrooms are found in houses. Schools have classrooms, libraries, computer rooms, and playgrounds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A classroom, library, and computer room are all found in a school. A bedroom is found at home, not in school.

questions.question_text: The teacher asks the class to clean up after an art activity. What should you do?

options.text: Leave your mess and go play
Ask someone else to clean your mess
Help clean up together with classmates
Hide the mess under the desk

questions.explanation_correct: You should help clean up together with classmates. Working as a team to clean up is good teamwork and keeps the classroom tidy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaving your mess, asking others to clean for you, or hiding the mess are not good habits. Cleaning up together shows teamwork and responsibility.

questions.question_text: A new student joins your class. What should you do?

options.text: Not let them sit near you

questions.explanation_correct: We should be friendly and say hello to a new student. This makes them feel welcome and happy in the new school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ignoring, laughing, or not letting someone sit near you is unkind. Being friendly and welcoming is what good friends do.

questions.question_text: You want to borrow a book from the library. Who will help you?
questions.explanation_correct: The librarian will help you borrow a book. The librarian keeps track of all the books and helps students find what they want to read.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The gardener, peon, and sweeper have different jobs. The librarian is the person in charge of the library and helping students with books.

questions.question_text: Which of these should we wear to school?
questions.explanation_correct: We should wear our school uniform to school. Wearing a uniform makes everyone look the same and is an important school rule.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Party dresses, pyjamas, and swimming costumes are not for school. We must wear our school uniform when we go to school.

questions.question_text: During assembly, Kavita talks to her friend. What should she do instead?
questions.explanation_correct: During assembly, Kavita should stand quietly and listen. Assembly is a time when the whole school gathers and everyone should pay attention.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Talking, singing loudly on your own, or sitting on the floor during assembly is not proper behaviour. Standing quietly and listening is the right thing to do.

questions.question_text: What do we sit on in the classroom?
questions.explanation_correct: We sit on a chair or bench in the classroom. Desks and chairs or benches are the furniture we use in class to sit and write.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Beds and sofas are found at home, not in classrooms. In school, we sit on chairs or benches to study.

questions.question_text: The school bell rings. What does it mean?

options.text: It is time to run outside
It is time to change the period or go home

questions.explanation_correct: The school bell tells us it is time to change the period, have a break, or go home. We should follow the bell and go to the right place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bell does not mean we should run outside or sleep. It is an important signal that tells us about the school timetable.

questions.question_text: Where do we play games in school?
questions.explanation_correct: We play games on the playground. The playground is the open area in school where we can run, play, and exercise.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The classroom is for studying, the library is for reading, and the principal's office is for the principal. We play games on the playground.

questions.question_text: Two friends want to play with the same ball. What should they do?
questions.explanation_correct: They should take turns playing with the ball. Taking turns is a fair way to share and play together happily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fighting, crying, or not playing at all are not good solutions. Taking turns is the best way for friends to share and play.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a school rule?
questions.explanation_correct: Eating sweets in class is not a school rule. We are not supposed to eat during class time. Coming on time, wearing uniform, and listening to the teacher are all good school rules.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coming on time, wearing uniform, and listening to the teacher are all proper school rules. Eating sweets in class is something we should not do.

questions.question_text: Match the school helper with their job: The person who opens and closes the school gate is the ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The peon opens and closes the school gate. The peon also rings the bell and helps with many tasks around the school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The teacher teaches lessons, the librarian looks after books, and the gardener cares for plants. The peon is the helper who opens the gate and rings the bell.

questions.question_text: Ravi sees his friend cheating during a test. What should Ravi do?

options.text: Tell his friend it is wrong and inform the teacher

questions.explanation_correct: Ravi should tell his friend that cheating is wrong and inform the teacher. Following rules and being honest are important in school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cheating, ignoring cheating, or laughing are not good responses. A good student follows rules and helps friends understand that cheating is wrong.

questions.question_text: Which group of things are ALL classroom objects?
questions.explanation_correct: Blackboard, chalk, and duster are all classroom objects. They are used together for teaching - the teacher writes with chalk and cleans the board with a duster.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pillows, blankets, and beds are bedroom things. Spoons, plates, and glasses are kitchen things. Shovels, buckets, and hoses are garden tools. Only blackboard, chalk, and duster are classroom objects.

questions.question_text: Why do we have different rooms in a school?

options.text: To make the school look big
Each room has a different purpose
So we can hide in them

questions.explanation_correct: Different rooms in school have different purposes. The classroom is for learning, the library is for reading, the playground is for playing, and so on.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rooms in school are not just for show or hiding. Each room serves a purpose - classrooms for studying, library for reading, playground for games.

questions.question_text: A class project works best when all students ___.

options.text: Let one person do all the work
Share the work and help each other
Do not talk to each other

questions.explanation_correct: A class project works best when everyone shares the work and helps each other. This is what good teamwork means.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Letting one person do everything, fighting, or not talking does not make a good project. Sharing work and helping each other is the best teamwork.

questions.question_text: Who drives the school bus?
questions.explanation_correct: The bus driver drives the school bus. The bus driver picks us up from home and drops us safely to school and back.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The teacher, principal, and gardener have different jobs in school. The bus driver is the person who drives the school bus.

questions.question_text: Why is it important to keep our school clean?

options.text: So we can get a holiday
So we stay healthy and our school looks nice

questions.explanation_correct: Keeping our school clean is important because it helps us stay healthy and makes our school look nice. A clean school is good for everyone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping school clean is not about holidays or making someone happy. It helps everyone stay healthy and creates a nice place to learn.

questions.question_text: Which of these shows good teamwork?

options.text: Only the best student answers all questions
Everyone takes part and helps each other
Only the teacher does the work

questions.explanation_correct: Good teamwork means everyone takes part and helps each other. When all students work together, the result is much better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: One person doing everything, only the teacher working, or copying are not teamwork. Everyone participating and helping each other is true teamwork.

questions.question_text: We should come to school on time.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should come to school on time. It is an important rule that helps us not miss lessons and be ready to learn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Coming to school on time is a very important rule. If we come late, we miss important lessons.

questions.question_text: A blackboard is used for cooking food.
questions.explanation_correct: A blackboard is not used for cooking. A blackboard is found in the classroom and the teacher writes on it with chalk to teach us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. A blackboard is a classroom object used for writing and teaching, not for cooking food.

questions.question_text: The librarian takes care of the school garden.
questions.explanation_correct: The librarian does not take care of the garden. The librarian looks after the books in the library. The gardener takes care of the garden.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. The librarian looks after books in the library. The gardener is the person who takes care of the school garden.

questions.question_text: Sharing our things with friends is a good habit.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, sharing our things with friends is a good habit. When we share, we make our friends happy and show that we care.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Sharing with friends is a wonderful habit. It makes everyone feel good and shows we are kind.

questions.question_text: We should run in the school corridor.
questions.explanation_correct: We should not run in the school corridor. Running in the corridor can cause us to fall or bump into others. We should always walk.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Running in the corridor is dangerous. We could fall or hurt someone. Walking safely is the school rule.

questions.question_text: The principal is the head of the school.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the principal is the head of the school. The principal manages the whole school and makes important decisions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The principal is indeed the head of the school who looks after everything and everyone in the school.

questions.question_text: A pencil can be sharpened using an eraser.
questions.explanation_correct: A pencil cannot be sharpened using an eraser. An eraser is used to rub out pencil marks. We use a sharpener to sharpen a pencil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. An eraser is for rubbing out mistakes. A sharpener is the correct tool for sharpening a pencil.

questions.question_text: Working alone is always better than working in a team.
questions.explanation_correct: Working alone is not always better. When we work in a team, we can share ideas, help each other, and finish work faster and better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. Teamwork is very helpful. When we work together, we get more ideas and can help each other, making the work better.

questions.question_text: The peon rings the school bell.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the peon rings the school bell. The bell tells everyone when it is time to start class, have a break, or go home.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The peon is the school helper who rings the bell at the right times throughout the school day.

questions.question_text: The library is a place in school where we can borrow books to read.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the library is a special room in school where we can borrow books to read. The librarian helps us choose and borrow books.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The school library has many books that we can borrow and read. It is a quiet place for reading and learning.
